segment.source: 3D printing from your app
segment.target: 3D printing from your app

segment.source: Learn how to add 3D printing functionality to your Universal Windows app.
segment.target: Learn how to add 3D printing functionality to your Universal Windows app.

segment.source: This topic covers how to launch the 3D print dialog after ensuring your 3D model is printable and in the correct format.
segment.target: This topic covers how to launch the 3D print dialog after ensuring your 3D model is printable and in the correct format.

segment.source: Windows.Graphics.Printing3D
segment.target: Windows.Graphics.Printing3D

segment.source: Learn how to add 3D printing functionality to your Universal Windows app.
segment.target: Learn how to add 3D printing functionality to your Universal Windows app.

segment.source: This topic covers how to launch the 3D print dialog after ensuring your 3D model is printable and in the correct format.
segment.target: This topic covers how to launch the 3D print dialog after ensuring your 3D model is printable and in the correct format.

segment.source: Class setup
segment.target: Class setup

segment.source: In your class that is to have 3D print functionality, add the Windows.Graphics.Printing3D namespace.
segment.target: In your class that is to have 3D print functionality, add the Windows.Graphics.Printing3D namespace.

segment.source: 3DPrintNamespace
segment.target: 3DPrintNamespace

segment.source: The following additional namespaces will be used in this particular guide:
segment.target: The following additional namespaces will be used in this particular guide:

segment.source: OtherNamespaces
segment.target: OtherNamespaces

segment.source: Next, give your class some helpful member fields.
segment.target: Next, give your class some helpful member fields.

segment.source: Declare a Print3DTask object to serve as a reference to the printing task that is to be passed to the print driver.
segment.target: Declare a Print3DTask object to serve as a reference to the printing task that is to be passed to the print driver.

segment.source: Declare a StorageFile object to hold the original 3D data file.
segment.target: Declare a StorageFile object to hold the original 3D data file.

segment.source: Finally, declare a Printing3D3MFPackage object, which represents a print-ready 3D model with all necessary metadata.
segment.target: Finally, declare a Printing3D3MFPackage object, which represents a print-ready 3D model with all necessary metadata.

segment.source: DeclareVars
segment.target: DeclareVars

segment.source: Create a simple UI
segment.target: Create a simple UI

segment.source: This sample uses three user controls: a load button which will bring a file into program memory, a fix button which will modify the file as necessary, and a print button which will initiate the printing job.
segment.target: This sample uses three user controls: a load button which will bring a file into program memory, a fix button which will modify the file as necessary, and a print button which will initiate the printing job.

segment.source: The following code generates these buttons (with their click event handlers) in your class' XAML file:
segment.target: The following code generates these buttons (with their click event handlers) in your class' XAML file:

segment.source: Buttons
segment.target: Buttons

segment.source: Add a TextBlock for UI feedback.
segment.target: Add a TextBlock for UI feedback.

segment.source: OutputText
segment.target: OutputText

segment.source: Get the 3D data
segment.target: Get the 3D data

segment.source: The method by which your app acquires 3D geometry data to print will vary.
segment.target: The method by which your app acquires 3D geometry data to print will vary.

segment.source: Your app may retrieve data from a 3D scan, pull model data from a web resource, or generate a 3D mesh programmatically using equations.
segment.target: Your app may retrieve data from a 3D scan, pull model data from a web resource, or generate a 3D mesh programmatically using equations.

segment.source: For the sake of simplicity, this guide will load a 3D data file (of any of several common file types) into program memory from File Explorer.
segment.target: For the sake of simplicity, this guide will load a 3D data file (of any of several common file types) into program memory from File Explorer.

segment.source: In your method, use the FileOpenPicker class to load a single file into your app's memory.
segment.target: In your method, use the FileOpenPicker class to load a single file into your app's memory.

segment.source: FileLoad
segment.target: FileLoad

segment.source: Use 3D Builder to convert to 3D Manufacturing Format (.3mf)
segment.target: Use 3D Builder to convert to 3D Manufacturing Format (.3mf)

segment.source: At this point, you are able to load a 3D data file into your app's memory.
segment.target: At this point, you are able to load a 3D data file into your app's memory.

segment.source: However, 3D geometry data comes in many different formats, and not all are efficient for 3D printing.
segment.target: However, 3D geometry data comes in many different formats, and not all are efficient for 3D printing.

segment.source: Windows 10 uses the 3D Manufacturing Format (.3mf) file type for all 3D Printing tasks.
segment.target: Windows 10 uses the 3D Manufacturing Format (.3mf) file type for all 3D Printing tasks.

segment.source: Note The 3MF file type offers a great deal of functionality not covered in this tutorial.
segment.target: Note The 3MF file type offers a great deal of functionality not covered in this tutorial.

segment.source: To learn more about 3MF and the features it provides to producers and consumers of 3D products, refer to the 3MF Specification.
segment.target: To learn more about 3MF and the features it provides to producers and consumers of 3D products, refer to the 3MF Specification.

segment.source: Fortunately, the 3D Builder app can open files of most popular 3D formats and save them as .3mf files.
segment.target: Fortunately, the 3D Builder app can open files of most popular 3D formats and save them as .3mf files.

segment.source: In this example, where the file type may vary, a very simple solution is to open 3D Builder and prompt the user to save the imported data as a .3mf file and then reload it.
segment.target: In this example, where the file type may vary, a very simple solution is to open 3D Builder and prompt the user to save the imported data as a .3mf file and then reload it.

segment.source: Note In addition to converting file formats, 3D Builder provides simple tools to edit your models, add color data, and perform other print-specific operations, so it is often worth integrating into an app that deals with 3D printing.
segment.target: Note In addition to converting file formats, 3D Builder provides simple tools to edit your models, add color data, and perform other print-specific operations, so it is often worth integrating into an app that deals with 3D printing.

segment.source: FileCheck
segment.target: FileCheck

segment.source: Repair model data for 3D printing
segment.target: Repair model data for 3D printing

segment.source: Not all 3D model data is able to be printed, even in .3mf format.
segment.target: Not all 3D model data is able to be printed, even in .3mf format.

segment.source: In order for the printer to correctly determine what space to fill and what to leave empty, the model(s) to be printed must be a single seamless mess, have outward-facing surface normals, and have manifold geometry.
segment.target: In order for the printer to correctly determine what space to fill and what to leave empty, the model(s) to be printed must be a single seamless mess, have outward-facing surface normals, and have manifold geometry.

segment.source: Issues in these areas can crop up in a variety of different forms and can be hard to spot in complex shapes.
segment.target: Issues in these areas can crop up in a variety of different forms and can be hard to spot in complex shapes.

segment.source: Fortunately, current software solutions are often adequate for converting raw geometry to printable 3D shapes.
segment.target: Fortunately, current software solutions are often adequate for converting raw geometry to printable 3D shapes.

segment.source: This will be done in the method.
segment.target: This will be done in the method.

segment.source: The 3D data file must be converted to implement IRandomAccessStream, which can then be used to generate a Printing3DModel object.
segment.target: The 3D data file must be converted to implement IRandomAccessStream, which can then be used to generate a Printing3DModel object.

segment.source: RepairModel
segment.target: RepairModel

segment.source: The Printing3DModel object is now repaired and printable.
segment.target: The Printing3DModel object is now repaired and printable.

segment.source: Use SaveModelToPackageAsync to assign the model to the Printing3D3MFPackage object you declared when creating the class.
segment.target: Use SaveModelToPackageAsync to assign the model to the Printing3D3MFPackage object you declared when creating the class.

segment.source: SaveModel
segment.target: SaveModel

segment.source: Execute printing task: create a TaskRequested handler
segment.target: Execute printing task: create a TaskRequested handler

segment.source: Later on, when the 3D print dialog is displayed to the user and the user elects to begin printing, your app will need to pass in the desired parameters to the 3D print pipeline.
segment.target: Later on, when the 3D print dialog is displayed to the user and the user elects to begin printing, your app will need to pass in the desired parameters to the 3D print pipeline.

segment.source: The 3D print API will raise the TaskRequested event.
segment.target: The 3D print API will raise the TaskRequested event.

segment.source: You must write a method to handle this event appropriately.
segment.target: You must write a method to handle this event appropriately.

segment.source: As always, it must be of the same type as its event: The TaskRequested event has parameters Print3DManager (its sender object) and a Print3DTaskRequestedEventArgs object, which holds most of the relevant information.
segment.target: As always, it must be of the same type as its event: The TaskRequested event has parameters Print3DManager (its sender object) and a Print3DTaskRequestedEventArgs object, which holds most of the relevant information.

segment.source: Its return type is void.
segment.target: Its return type is void.

segment.source: MyTaskTitle
segment.target: MyTaskTitle

segment.source: The core purpose of this method is to use the args object to send a Printing3D3MFPackage down the pipeline.
segment.target: The core purpose of this method is to use the args object to send a Printing3D3MFPackage down the pipeline.

segment.source: The Print3DTaskRequestedEventArgs type has one property: Request.
segment.target: The Print3DTaskRequestedEventArgs type has one property: Request.

segment.source: It is of the type Print3DTaskRequest and represents one print job request.
segment.target: It is of the type Print3DTaskRequest and represents one print job request.

segment.source: Its method CreateTask allows the program to submit the right information for your print job, and it returns a reference to the Print3DTask object which is sent down the 3D print pipeline.
segment.target: Its method CreateTask allows the program to submit the right information for your print job, and it returns a reference to the Print3DTask object which is sent down the 3D print pipeline.

segment.source: CreateTask has the following input parameters: A string for the print job name, a string for the ID of the printer to use, and a Print3DTaskSourceRequestedHandler delegate.
segment.target: CreateTask has the following input parameters: A string for the print job name, a string for the ID of the printer to use, and a Print3DTaskSourceRequestedHandler delegate.

segment.source: The delegate is automatically invoked when the 3DTaskSourceRequested event is raised (this is done by the API itself).
segment.target: The delegate is automatically invoked when the 3DTaskSourceRequested event is raised (this is done by the API itself).

segment.source: The important thing to note is that this delegate is invoked when a print job is initiated, and it is responsible for providing the right 3D print package.
segment.target: The important thing to note is that this delegate is invoked when a print job is initiated, and it is responsible for providing the right 3D print package.

segment.source: Print3DTaskSourceRequestedHandler takes one parameter, a Print3DTaskSourceRequestedArgs object which provides the data to be sent.
segment.target: Print3DTaskSourceRequestedHandler takes one parameter, a Print3DTaskSourceRequestedArgs object which provides the data to be sent.

segment.source: The one public method of this class, SetSource, accepts the package to be printed.
segment.target: The one public method of this class, SetSource, accepts the package to be printed.

segment.source: Implement a Print3DTaskSourceRequestedHandler delegate as follows:
segment.target: Implement a Print3DTaskSourceRequestedHandler delegate as follows:

segment.source: SourceHandler
segment.target: SourceHandler

segment.source: Next, call CreateTask, using the newly-defined delegate :
segment.target: Next, call CreateTask, using the newly-defined delegate :

segment.source: CreateTask
segment.target: CreateTask

segment.source: The returned Print3DTask is assigned to the class variable declared in the beginning.
segment.target: The returned Print3DTask is assigned to the class variable declared in the beginning.

segment.source: You can now (optionally) use this reference to handle certain events thrown by the task:
segment.target: You can now (optionally) use this reference to handle certain events thrown by the task:

segment.source: Optional
segment.target: Optional

segment.source: Note You must implement a and method if you wish to register them to these events.
segment.target: Note You must implement a and method if you wish to register them to these events.

segment.source: Execute printing task: open 3D print dialog
segment.target: Execute printing task: open 3D print dialog

segment.source: The final bit of code needed to print from your app is that which launches the 3D print dialog.
segment.target: The final bit of code needed to print from your app is that which launches the 3D print dialog.

segment.source: Like a conventional printing dialog window, the 3D print dialog provides a number of last-minute printing specifications and allows the user to choose which printer to use (whether connected via USB or the network).
segment.target: Like a conventional printing dialog window, the 3D print dialog provides a number of last-minute printing specifications and allows the user to choose which printer to use (whether connected via USB or the network).

segment.source: First, register your method with the TaskRequested event.
segment.target: First, register your method with the TaskRequested event.

segment.source: RegisterMyTaskRequested
segment.target: RegisterMyTaskRequested

segment.source: After registering your TaskRequested event handler, you can invoke the method ShowPrintUIAsync, which brings up the 3D print dialog in the current application window.
segment.target: After registering your TaskRequested event handler, you can invoke the method ShowPrintUIAsync, which brings up the 3D print dialog in the current application window.

segment.source: ShowDialog
segment.target: ShowDialog

segment.source: Finally, it is a good practice to de-register your event handlers once your app resumes control: DeregisterMyTaskRequested
segment.target: Finally, it is a good practice to de-register your event handlers once your app resumes control: DeregisterMyTaskRequested
